definition: to tidy up/to mop up/a sweep (against crime)
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: S7:I'm going to be a cleaner to clean the gyms and take out the trash.
sentences.chinese: 我準備當上一名清潔工，清運垃圾，清掃體育場。

sentences.english: She tried to brownnose the boss by staying after work and helping him clean the room.
sentences.chinese: 她企圖在下班後呆下來幫老闆清掃房間以討好他。

sentences.english: Here is the deal. You clean the kitchen and I clean the bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 就這樣說定了，你清掃廚房，我清理浴室。

sentences.english: They clean their houses, have their hair cut, and buy new clothes.
sentences.chinese: 他們清掃他們的屋子，剃頭和買新衣服。

sentences.english: A day or a period is set aside for cleaning.
sentences.chinese: 人們會設定一天或是一段時間來作大清掃。

sentences.english: The sweeper cannot vibrate in high amplitude when sweeping the stuff.
sentences.chinese: 清掃器清掃物料時不會大振幅跳動。

sentences.english: The sweeper cannot vibrate in high amplitude when sweeping the stuff.
sentences.chinese: 清掃器清掃物料時不會大振幅跳動。

sentences.english: After a deep sleep the weeping sweeper keeps on peeping the sheep on the steep.
sentences.chinese: 酣睡之後哭泣的清掃者繼續窺視峭擺上的羊。

sentences.english: More specifically, what is it to be a sanitation worker in the city today?
sentences.chinese: 更確切地說，今天誰會成爲這個城市的垃圾清掃工？

sentences.english: It is reported that Suleiman had promised to Israel for its "sweeping Sinai mountains."
sentences.chinese: 據悉，蘇萊曼曾向以色列許諾要爲其“清掃西奈山”。

sentences.english: After all the guests had left, I swept up.
sentences.chinese: 客人都走後，我清掃了房間。

sentences.english: It makes me want to join a clean-up campaign.
sentences.chinese: 這使我想進入一次清掃運動。

sentences.english: The department provides manual street-sweeping services in all urban and rural areas.
sentences.chinese: 該署安排潔淨人員，在市區和郊區清掃街道。

sentences.english: So after school, I started to clear the rubbish away.
sentences.chinese: 於是我放學回家後就開始清掃那堆垃圾。

definition: preparedness/to bring sth to a state of readiness
faultless/complete/perfect/to leave nothing to be desired
disaster prevention/to protect against natural disasters
to introduce into/to channel/to lead/to guide into/to import (data)
